data.title: Still the best
data.text: Stopped at Grand Traverse Pie Company when we were in Terre Haute again this fall and it's still the best pie in America in our opinion. This time, we also took out lunches, a Reuben and Turkey Reuben and both were delicious! Got Cherry Crumble, Apple Crumble and Pumpkin whole pies to go too. In a day, we've already made it thru half the cherry pie and decided to freeze the other two for Thanksgiving. Love that the pies look at great as they taste too, with the sweet heart in the middle!  Our only complaint about Grand Traverse Pie is that they don't ship them!

data.title: Great Place for Mid-Morning Break
data.text: We were too late in the morning for breakfast and too early for lunch while traveling through Terre Haute and decided to stop at the Grand Traverse Pie Company for a slice of pie and cup of coffee.  Everything there was topnotch.  Having never been there before, we needed time to check out the menu before making a selection.  The counter people were polite and understanding.  I had a muffin (a little dry but very tasty) and my husband had strawberry rhubarb pie, which he said was almost as good as my Mother's!  One negative was that there was a selection of 5 different coffees (serve yourself) but 3 of them were empty.  Overall, a good experience.

data.title: Very Nice place to get a light meal and meet with others in the intown area
data.text: This restaurant is a family operation. It is one of an early attempt at a franchise chain. I am not sure how that is going, but this one is solid. It opens early for coffee and brunch type foods. They have many salads and soups for light fare. They also have Pies. So many excellent choices too. They have wifi and do not mind people coming in and hanging out for a while without eating. I love to support this place to support the owner. He is a hard working a very nice guy.

data.title: Great place to eat
data.text: This place was great!   We ordered take out and I did not pick up so I cannot sprak fit the building itself but the food is amazing.  Great variety to choose from soups, salads, sandwhiches and my favorite....chicken pot pie!  Their pies are great too but with the large portions I had to put mine up for later.

data.title: Great for lunch
data.text: The Pie Company has a great selection of lunch menu items. The service is usually quick, which is good for people on a schedule. Their pies are delicious, although probably pretty unhealthy.

data.title: A pie shop with lunch-type meals.
data.text:
This restaurant features pies and sandwiches and pastry-based meals found in the state of Michigan. It is the only restaurant in the chain of 15 outside of Michigan.

It is similar to Panera's, in level of service. You order at the counter when ready your name is called for you to pickup. Drinks are  self-service.

I had a combo: beef pot pie, salad, and slice pie (choice of 2 dozen) peach crumble for about $11.00.

The pot pie crust was not flakey but the filling was hot -- suggesting a prepared refrigerated pie that was microwaved. The salad was fresh, there were many dressing option. The best dish was my peach crumble pie which was expertly crafted and delicious. 

Free WiFi, bright decor, and a covered patio were highlights to an average entre;  dessert is the premier feature in this pie shop with lunch-type meals. They are within walking distance to Indiana State University and is located along highways U. S. 41.

data.title: Pie.  Great Pie.  Plus Coffee...
data.text: Their quiches are fantastic; great slabs of fluffy egg and cheese goodness in flaky tasty crust.  Good coffee...esp the Michigan Cherry.  But save room for the pie.  Oh my goodness. So many great pies!   Full disclosure: I bake a mean pie and quiche.  So I am tough to please.  But wow.  Love the strawberry rhubarb.  Very cozy restaurant with meeting room and places for large groups to gather.  You can fill and refill your coffee cup to your hearts desire.  There are lots of choices beyond quiche and pie...not all even involve crusts. You cannot go wrong here!

data.title: Great pie
data.text: Great pie. I had crumb topped strawberry rhubarb pie and hubby had coconut cream. Both were excellent. We also had lunch which was good but nothing special the pie made the meal worth going back. Too bad we don't live in Terra Haute or maybe it's a good thing 😀😀

data.title: Kind of average
data.text: Full disclosure - I did not have any pie.  My companions said their pies are just good, not great (although they look delicious!).  I had a baked potato and it was great. Service could have been a little friendlier.

data.title: Lunch and pie!
data.text: Just about any kind of pie you can think of, plus sandwiches, wraps, salads, soups, pot pies.It was all good. Did I mention pie??

data.title: Good lunch!
data.text: I recommend the beef pastry and a piece of cherry pie. That's what I had. Can't go wrong! Enjoy the cherry flavored coffee, too, if you like that sort of thing. But, they have a variety of blends to choose from.

data.title: Panera like
data.text: there were lots of options and you could create your own things.  You walk up and order there, mush like Panera.  The pie and baked goods were yummy

data.title: Homemade pie and hospitality
data.text: Was visiting R-H and came in late, 30 minutes before closing. Greeted with a warm welcome and no hint of annoyance that we were coming in as they probably were cleaning up for close. They were friendly and helpful with suggestions. I was fighting a head cold and the chicken noodle soup was a great comfort. We all had various pies with ice cream that reminded us of what mom would make. Our choices were apple crumb, a mixed berry and I can't remember what my daughter had, she ate it too fast. Cute homey decor and tasty pie.

data.title: Good pie selection
data.text: Good food, fast service, a little pricey but worth the money.  I eat here every visit to TH.  Berry crunch pies are very good, especially heated and ala mode.

data.title: Food good; pie excellent
data.text:
Our lunch was fine, with nice fresh salad greens. The white chicken chili was a little too salty; the ham and cheese quiche tender but unexciting. 

We then tried the cherry pie and coconut cream pie. Cherry was very good, with plenty of fruit and a distinct, authentic tartness in the cherries. The coconut cream  was outstanding, with lots of coconut, dense eggy custard, and a remarkably flaky crust even under the moist filling. You don't find cream pies that good very often! Recommended.

data.title: Fresh and reasonably priced
data.text: Had a great salad that was a good sze and ISU students get free pie with purchase. Also loved reasonable prices.

data.title: Delicious in Terre haute
data.text: Have loved this delicious selection of food and pies.   It's one of my favorite places to eat but the service is curt and rude.  So disappointed.    Cashier does not listen and raises her voice.  Frustrated and may need to rethink about coming so regularly

owner_response.author: Erin M, Guest Relations Manager at Grand Traverse Pie Company, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Georgianna, thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review for us. While I love to hear that you enjoy the food and pies, I'm really disappointed to hear that our staff was unfriendly. We truly pride ourselves on having both wonderful food and happy, friendly employees. We would love to have the opportunity to talk to you more about your review and invite you back in to give us another chance. Would you mind sending me an email at gtpiesocial@gmail.com with either your phone number or email address? Thank you again! - Erin, GT Pie Social Media Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great pie
data.text: Wouldn't have a better experience then this. Would not change anything about this jewel in Terre Haute. Any occasion.

data.title: Only place to go for pie!
data.text: They have the best pies and the widest selection every day.  Good place to meet with friends or a business meeting over coffee and pie.

data.title: Quiche, Pastry, Soup, and Pie
data.text: We visited the Terre Haute location in early July on our way back to the Midwest and were satisfied with the food and service here. I really was hoping for something more of a wow factor from this place, but didn't get that with our food choices. I truly enjoyed the Mediterranean Quiche and would surely go back for that again if we were closer though. We also tried the Apple Pecan Caramel pie and the Peach Pie. If I had the chance to choose again id just get Peach Pie all the way and maybe even buy an extra to bring home too ☺️ it was delicious! This place is worth a stop and affordable, just don't expect it to make you swoon. 😉
